fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views

Interface IListViewStore


  • @PluginService
public interface IListViewStore
    Extension point to enable customization of persistent storage for list view definitions.

    Instances of this storage service are made available to the IDataViewService via the OSGi service registry. Implementations are selected in order of priority, starting with the highest service.ranking property first, followed by the service.id property.

    Note that conceptually, there are two aspects to this interface:

    • The operational aspect interface (methods getStoredViews, store, and drop), used by IDataViewService and IListView.
    • The management aspect interface (methods getStoredSources, dropSourceReferences, getStoredDirectories, dropDirectoryReferences, getStoredUsers, and dropUserReferences), used to implement administration interfaces for maintaining the persistent list view store (in particular, to clean up obsolete data that may accumulate as the user directory and application structure evolves).

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drop(IListView adaptedListView)
      Drops the definition of the specified list view from a persistent store.
      void dropDirectoryReferences(UUID directoryAttachId)
      Deletes all references to the specified directory, including all references to users associated with the directory, stored by this list view store.
      void dropSourceReferences(UUID sourceAttachId)
      Deletes all references to the specified fetchable data source stored by this list view store.
      void dropUserReferences(UUID directoryAttachId, String userPrincipal)
      Deletes all references to the specified user stored by this list view store.
      Set<UUID> getStoredDirectories()
      Gets the attachment ID of all user directories referred to in this list view store.
      Set<UUID> getStoredSources()
      Gets the attachment ID of all sources (including intersections) referred to in this list view store.
      Set<String> getStoredUsers(UUID directoryAttachId)
      Gets the principals of all users referred to in this list view store, in the scope of the specified directory.
      List<IListView> getStoredViews(IListViewFactory factory)
      Gets all stored views available as variants of a reference list view, using the supplied factory object.
      void store(IListView adaptedListView)
      Writes the definition of the specified list view to a persistent store, for later retrieval.

    • Method Detail

      • getStoredViews

        List<IListView> getStoredViews(IListViewFactory factory)
                        throws IOException
        Gets all stored views available as variants of a reference list view, using the supplied factory object.
        Parameters:
        factory - the non-null factory used to restore named list views based on a reference from which the returned list of variants are derived adaptations.
        Returns:
        the stored variants. May be an empty list, will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a read error occurred.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDataViewService.getStoredViews(IListView)

      • store

        void store(IListView adaptedListView)
    throws IOException
        Writes the definition of the specified list view to a persistent store, for later retrieval.
        Parameters:
        adaptedListView - the non-null list view to store. If the owner has already defined a stored with the same name for the specified source, then the older copy will be overwritten. The specified view may not use the initial view name assigned automatically to reference views.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a write error occurred.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IListView.store(String)

      • drop

        void drop(IListView adaptedListView)
   throws IOException
        Drops the definition of the specified list view from a persistent store.
        Parameters:
        adaptedListView - the non-null list view to store. If the owner has already defined a stored with the same name for the specified source, then the older copy will be overwritten. The specified view may not use the initial view name assigned automatically to reference views.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurred when deleting.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getStoredSources

        Set<UUID> getStoredSources()
                    throws IOException
        Gets the attachment ID of all sources (including intersections) referred to in this list view store.

        The returned UUIDs correspond to the attachment ID of the fetch source.

        Returns:
        a set containing the attachment ID of all references to sources (and intersections) that are known to this list view store. If there are no such references, an empty set is returned, not null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs reading data from the store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDataViewService.getStoredViews(IListView), dropSourceReferences(java.util.UUID)

      • getStoredDirectories

        Set<UUID> getStoredDirectories()
                        throws IOException
        Gets the attachment ID of all user directories referred to in this list view store.
        Returns:
        a set containing the attachment ID of all references to user directories that are known to this list view store. If there are no such references, an empty set is returned, not null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs reading data from the store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDataViewService.getStoredViews(IListView), getStoredUsers(java.util.UUID), dropDirectoryReferences(java.util.UUID)

      • getStoredUsers

        Set<String> getStoredUsers(UUID directoryAttachId)
                    throws IOException
        Gets the principals of all users referred to in this list view store, in the scope of the specified directory. User principals are only required to be unique within the scope of the user directory with which they are associated.
        Parameters:
        directoryAttachId - the non-null attachment ID of the directory with which the returned user principals are returned. This parameter is required to avoid conflicts between non-unique user principals that may be found when multiple directories are available.
        Returns:
        a set containing the principals of all references to users in the scope of the specified user directory that are known to this list view store. If there are no such references, an empty set is returned, not null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs reading data from the store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IDataViewService.getStoredViews(IListView), getStoredDirectories(), dropUserReferences(java.util.UUID, String)

      • dropSourceReferences

        void dropSourceReferences(UUID sourceAttachId)
                   throws IOException
        Deletes all references to the specified fetchable data source stored by this list view store.

        The specified UUID must be compared with the attachment ID of the fetch source and with the master source.

        Parameters:
        sourceAttachId - the non-null attachment ID of the fetchable data source for which references are to be deleted.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs deleting data from the store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getStoredSources(), IListView.drop()

      • dropDirectoryReferences

        void dropDirectoryReferences(UUID directoryAttachId)
                      throws IOException
        Deletes all references to the specified directory, including all references to users associated with the directory, stored by this list view store.
        Parameters:
        directoryAttachId - the non-null attachment ID of the user directory for which references are to be deleted.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs deleting data from the store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getStoredDirectories(), IListView.drop()

      • dropUserReferences

        void dropUserReferences(UUID directoryAttachId,
                        String userPrincipal)
                 throws IOException
        Deletes all references to the specified user stored by this list view store.
        Parameters:
        directoryAttachId - the non-null attachment ID of the user directory containing the specified user principal, for which references are to be deleted.
        userPrincipal - the non-null user principal for which references are to be deleted.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs deleting data from the store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getStoredSources(), IListView.drop()
